roleset.name: operate, proceed, operate or proceed

example.name: run-v: agentive
example.text: [Mr. Stromach]-1 wants to resume a more influential role in *trace*-1 running the company.

example.name: run-v: unaccusative
example.text: Construction spending ran at an annual rate of $415.6 billion.
example.arg: at an annual rate of $415.6 billion.

example.name: run-v: with instrument
example.text: 65% or more of Brazil's newly made automobiles run on alcohol.
example.arg: 65% or more of Brazil's newly made automobiles

example.name: run-n: Example with arg 1 as procede
example.text: prevent Martin Ackerman from [*] making a run at the computer-services concern

example.name: run-n: Another arg 1 as procede
example.text: you 're going [*]to make a run of it

roleset.note: RUN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'run' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'work.' For additional examples for this sense/roleset, refer to work.01. Could be interpreted as "walk quickly"sense also. Created by Olga (from run.01-v)
RUN-N NOTES: Roleset based on run.01-v. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from run.02-n)
RUNNING-N NOTES: (from running.01-n)

roleset.name: walk quickly, a course or contest, run/jog, run for office

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: According to the agreement , restrictions on those seeking association membership and sub-committee posts will be relaxed , but the rules will be tightened for those running for the posts of director or general secretary , excluding or removing from office anyone who is in default for more than a year on loans from these and other such financial organizations .
example.arg: for the posts of director or general secretary
excluding or removing from office anyone who is in default for more than a year on loans from these and other such financial organizations

example.name: run-v: Political race, with opponent
example.text: By *PRO* running against Giuliani, who has been reported in Vanity Fairto have a mistress, the first lady could...

example.name: run-v: ergative race
example.text: The Boston Marathon runs over Labor Day weekend.

example.name: run-v: with direction
example.text: A good number decide it's not worth it and run for home.

example.name: run-v: with pole position
example.text: The fact is that as a savings or investment vehicle, insurance generally runs a poor second to any direct investment you might make in the same things the insurance company is putting your money into.
example.arg: as a savings or investment vehicle,
a poor second to any direct investment you might make in the same things the insurance company is putting your money into.

example.name: run-n: Example with arg 0 and direction
example.text: He had to warm up for his run around the block

example.name: run-n: Example with both args
example.text: His run for governor

example.name: run-n: Another example with both args
example.text: Obama's 2008 presidential run

roleset.note: RUN-V NOTES: I am so going to get in trouble for that. Probably more natural as a passive: "The Boston Marathon is run over Labor Day weekend." Beware of "run out of the room", which could be misinterpreted as the phrasal "run_out". VN classes run-51.3.2, swarm-47.5.1-1 (from run.02-v)
RUN-N NOTES: Roleset based on eventive-nouns-00060. Comparison to run.02-v. Framed by Katie. (from run.06-n)
RUN-N NOTES: Roleset based on eventive-nouns-000060. Comparison to run.02-v. No corresponding Verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from run.07-n)
RUN-N NOTES: Roleset based on eventive-nouns-000060. Comparison to run.02-v. No corresponding Verbnet class. Framed by Katie.
RUNNING-N NOTES: (from running.02-n)

roleset.name: cost

example.name: run-v: wino
example.text: The spectacularly rich 1983 runs $179.

example.name: run-v: with buyer
example.text: Mad Dog, on the other hand, will run you a buck a bottle.

roleset.note: RUN-V NOTES: (from run.03-v)
RUNNING-N NOTES: (from running.03-n)

roleset.name: range, extend

example.name: run-v: extend
example.text: A variety of special interest amendments, running from an import exemption for a California airplane museum to a small but intriguing struggle among sugar producing nations over the fate of Panama's quota of exports to the profitable US market.
example.arg: A variety of special interest amendments,
from an import exemption for a California airplane museum
to a small but intriguing struggle among sugar producing nations over the fate of Panama's quota of exports to the profitable US market.

example.name: run-v: with arg0
example.text: She ran it the length of the South Gardens riverfront , blotting out the city 's great natural water features , the harbor and the river .
example.arg: the length of the South Gardens riverfront
blotting out the city 's great natural water features , the harbor and the river

roleset.note: RUN-V NOTES: VN class meander-47.7. (from run.04-v)
RUNNING-N NOTES: (from running.04-n)

roleset.name: run into: encounter

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: If you take an interest in the aboriginal tribes of central Taiwan , it wo n't be long before you run into the name of Teng Hsiang - yang .
example.arg: into the name of Teng Hsiang - yang

roleset.note: RUN-V NOTES: VN class bump-18.4 (from run.07-v)
RUNNING-N NOTES: (from running.07-n)

roleset.name: caused motion

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Prosecutors in Southern Florida indicted five Panamanians on charges of illegally running arms to Sandinista rebels trying to overthrow the Nicaraguan government of Mr. Somoza .
example.arg: to Sandinista rebels trying to overthrow the Nicaraguan government of Mr. Somoza

RUNNING-N NOTES: (from running.08-n)

roleset.name: cause to appear in media, broadcasting

example.name: run-v: without medium
example.text: The magazine's editors ran a giant diagram of the product with arrows pointing to the packaging's polystyrene foam, polyproplene and polyester film -- all plastic items they say arenon-biodegradable.
example.arg: a giant diagram of the product with arrows pointing to the packaging's polystyrene foam, polyproplene and polyester film -- all plastic items they say arenon-biodegradable.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Jim : WaPo ran the Wall Street Journal story on D 5 of Business .

RUNNING-N NOTES: (from running.09-n)

roleset.name: various idioms/multi-word expressions, various idioms, multi-word expressions

example.name: run-v: run the risk
example.text: ...the president does n't he run the risk of *PRO* looking like the little rich kid who *T* is not winning the game so he says it 's my ball.
example.arg: the risk of *PRO* looking like the little rich kid who *T* is not winning the game so he says it 's my ball.

example.name: run-v: run a tab
example.text: able *PRO* to run a tab

RUNNING-N NOTES: (from running.10-n)

roleset.name: progression over a specific (maybe time) span

example.name: run-v
example.text: The Dublin Conference runs until May 30

example.name: run-n: Example with arg 1
example.text: a decade-long run of unprecedented disasters

example.name: run-n: Example with arg 0 as copier
example.text: an initial press run of 100,000 copies

example.name: run-n: Example of run as in a length of time
example.text: In the long run,

example.name: run-n
example.text: A series of accidents has lead to the end of the Russians' Mir run

example.name: run-n
example.text: The show's 12 year run ended on Saturday

example.name: run-v
example.text: The show ran for 12 years

roleset.note: RUN-N NOTES: No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from run.01-n)
RUN-V NOTES: Added by Julia and Tim.
This sense is also used for stretches of time ('in the long run') (from run.01-n)

example.name: run-n: Another baseball example
example.text: A miracle home run by Kirk Gibson

example.text: There is a run in my stockings

roleset.name: nomlike-run-away

example.name: on_run-x: Example with 'on the run' in a clause, so you can't use arg 0
example.text: After six months on the run, Mr. Chan learned the order for hisarrest had been canceled .

example.name: on_run-x: Watch the trees, if you can annotate an arg 0, do so.
example.text: Steinbaugh, on the run from the police for attempted murder, turned up on Thursday evening.

roleset.note: RUN-N NOTES: Roleset based on escape.01. Comparison to escape.01. Verbnet class escape-51.1. Framed by Katie. (from run.05-n)

roleset.name: mass mad dash to take money out of the banks

example.name: run-n: arg1
example.text: Economist Maria Delapasvela , who works with the magazine Rabista Hastion says adopting the US dollar has put an end to Ecuador 's crisis atmosphere characterized by runs on banks andother disruptions .

example.name: run-n: both args
example.text: This is only the beginning as depositors have continued their run on the bank even after the bailout.

example.name: run-n: Light Verb
example.text: In October 1987, investors made a run on the bank and it had to close its doors.

roleset.note: RUN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No corresponding VNcls. (from run.09-n)

roleset.name: check information against a database

example.name: run-v
example.text: After he ran my plates against stolen vehicles and whatever else he needed to learn about my sleazy past, he came to my window with his hand on his holster.
example.arg: against stolen vehicles and whatever else he needed to learn about my sleazy past,

roleset.note: RUN-V NOTES: Added by Julia.

roleset.name: run out: exhaust, exhausting, running out

example.name: run_out-v: ergative
example.text: ...before the number of available nations runs out.

example.name: run_out-v: with beneficiary
example.text: ``We flat ran out of financing resources,'' Mr. Jerritts said.

RUNNING_OUT-N NOTES: (from running.05-n)

roleset.name: run up: accumulate, accumulating

example.name: run_up-v: poor planning
example.text: The ruling could lead to the cancellation of huge bank debts *trace* the London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham ran up *trace*after losing heavily on swap transactions.

RUNNING_UP-N NOTES: (from running.06-n)

roleset.name: progression (maybe time span) leading up to a deadline

example.name: run_up-n: arg2
example.text: Local elections took place peacefully across Colombia on Sunday despite violence that had marred the run - up to theelections .

example.name: run_up-n: arg1
example.text: For all of this year 's explosive run - up in stock prices , Renaissance Investment Management Inc. 's computer sat on the sidelines.

roleset.note: RUN_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. Corresponds to run-n.01, run_up-v.06, VNcls meander-47.7. (from run.10-n)

roleset.name: run_down: wear out, tire

example.name: run_down-v: ergative
example.text: Time to plug yourself in for a recharge , you re starting to run down .

example.name: run_down-v: more typical usage
example.text: You know you-1 are getting *-1 run down and overlytired when: 1. You're easily enervated. Little things set you off.

example.name: run_down-j
example.text: They are run down garbage everywhere with people just sitting about doing nothing .
example.arg: with people just sitting about doing nothing

roleset.note: RUN_DOWN-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT; adjectival 'run_down' based on BOLT-2,3. No VNcls. (from run.11-v)
RUN_DOWN-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from run.11-j)

example.name: run_down-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: A quick run down of what has been happening:

roleset.name: drive over somebody/something

example.name: run_over-v: args 0, 1
example.text: *PRO* Ran bike over , dragged it 300 feet , dead college student .

roleset.name: final round of voting between remaining candidates

role.descr: position candidate will be elected to, subject matter of election

example.name: run_off-n: Args 1 and 2
example.text: No, there isn't going to be a final run-off for President between a female candidate and an African-American candidate.
example.arg: between a female candidate and an African-American candidate.

example.name: run_off-n: Args 0 and 1
example.text: The issue came to a head in 1986 when the Democrats ruled too many Republicans had voted in their Run-Off between Bill Baxley and Charlie.

roleset.note: RUN_OFF-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No corresponding VNcls. (from run.08-n)
If you see an instance with more than one competitor, where each is individually taggable, we should add a role for that. No such examples found so far. (from run.08-n)

roleset.name: run away, abscond

example.name: run_off-v: arg3
example.text: A betrayed wife yesterday spoke of the torment she went through after her husband ran off with their married village GP.

example.name: run_off-v: arg1
example.text: I have a flatmate who [*] ran off with the deposit!

example.name: run_off-v: arg2 and PRP
example.text: The Joe's recruitment policies suffered once Flint and Duke ran off to Tahiti to open a bar.

roleset.name: encounter

example.name: run_in-n: arg2
example.text: Mr. Blinder said the change was n't related to the brokerage 's recent troubles , which have included sharp declines in earnings, run - ins with the securities regulators and lawsuits by former customers .

example.name: run_in-n: all args
example.text: Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver Jerome Simpson has plead guilty to the charges placed against him for his run-in with the law over marijuana.
